label: x
definition: Topical terms from Library of Congress Subject Headings (LCSH)
rationale: Explode subject headings into segments to allow filtering/narrowing by individual topical terms
notes: field_name includes "lcsh" because in Endeca, we also have a Medical Subject headings topic facet -- erring on the side of being more specific earlier on, based on Luke's advice that it'd be easier to generalize things later on than to tease out lost specifics;;;TD-347 specifies "limited to LCSH," though Endeca data model allowed terms from other vocabularies to be mapped here

label: x
definition: Genre/form terms
rationale: Explode subject and genre headings into segments to allow filtering/narrowing by individual genre/form terms
notes: field_name doesn't include name of a vocabulary because we've never treated genre terms from different vocabularies separately. I'll be making a case to POs that it's necessary to include terms from several non-LCSH vocabularies in this facet to make it at all useful.

label: x
definition: Chronological/time period terms from LCSH
rationale: Explode subject genre headings into segments to allow filtering/narrowing by individual chronological terms
notes: field_name doesn't include name of a vocabulary because we've never treated chronological terms from different vocabularies separately;;;TD-347 specifies "limited to LCSH," though Endeca data model allowed terms from other vocabularies to be mapped here

label: x
definition: Geographic/region terms from LCSH
rationale: Explode subject genre headings into segments to allow filtering/narrowing by individual geographic terms
notes: field_name doesn't include name of a vocabulary because we've never treated chronological terms from different vocabularies separately;;;TD-347 specifies "limited to LCSH," though Endeca data model allowed terms from other vocabularies to be mapped here

label: x
definition: Date that record was fully cataloged/completed. If this specific date is not available from the system, you could use a record creation date instead. DO NOT map a "record updated" date to this field.
rationale: Subject librarians use this facet, combined with call number range, to produce/link to lists of newly available materials of interest to users
implementation details: Transform to standard date format; map to desired date ranges (last week, last month, etc)

label: Language(s):
definition: Language(s) of the content in the material(s) described by the record
rationale: Limit/narrow results by language. Many resources are in more than one language. Users studying languages should be able to find materials that are in "English and French" ;;; Display language names in record
implementation details: Map language codes to preferred language terms for display (if not storage/indexing) -- http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/languages.html or http://www.loc.gov/standards/codelists/languages.xml ;;; Retain order because 008 language code is the "main" or first language in the item; in 041, codes are assigned in order of importance/amount of content

label: x
definition: Topical terms from MEdical Subject Headings (MeSH)
rationale: Explode medical subject headings into segments to allow filtering/narrowing by individual topical terms

label: x
definition: Topical terms from non-LCSH/MeSH vocabularies
rationale: Explode subject headings into segments to allow filtering/narrowing by individual topical terms. Endeca did not limit this facet to LCSH

label: Subject headings:
definition: Pre-coordinate subject headings
rationale: Display in record (in order); adaptive hyperlinking for browsing/exploring; feed into autosuggest and/or "related titles" features

label: Status: Due #{date}
definition: Item due date
rationale: Can be shown as part of item status if item checked out

label: x
definition: Unique identifier for an item record in host institution's ILS. Could be record number or barcode.
rationale: Of possible use for requesting or other features

label: (none)
definition: Library building/branch/larger location in which the shelving location is found
rationale: Inform user what library building or main section/area to go to in order to find the item
implementation details: Map to readable label for display

label: (none)
definition: Shelving location code for item
rationale: Inform user what section/area of stacks to go to in order to find the item
implementation details: Map to readable label for display

label: (none)
definition: Public notes from the item record
rationale: Provide specific information at the copy or volume level. Assist in select and obtain user tasks
implementation details: An item may have more than one item note. They should be displayed in order.

label: x
definition: Total of circulation counts for all items attached to bibliographic record
rationale: Used to sort by popularity
implementation details: SUM of circulation count for items attached to bib

label: (none)
definition: Full call number from item record (classification number + shelving cutter + shelf marks + volume/copy designators)
rationale: Obtain resource; sort items in display into a logical order

label: x
definition: Scheme (LCC, DDC, NLM, SUDOC, etc) from which item_call_number was assigned
rationale: Support/control features behind the scenes -- gives info on further processing of this info into other fields

label: (none)
definition: Status of individual item
rationale: Shows user whether item is available, library use only, checked out (and when due), missing, etc. Feeds into bib availability value
implementation details: Develop/agree upon a standard set of statuses, and how they map to bib_availability value?

definition: Type/format for individual item

label: x
definition: Placeholder for possibility of representing this in data/index instead of on-the-fly

displayed: institution- and/or format-specific decision (brief record, full record)
label: (none)
definition: For serials (and for some institutions, monographic series or sets), statement indicating what the library/location has for the title (volumes/years held, gaps, etc)
rationale: See what the library/location has without having to look through all the individual items/volumes

displayed: institution- and/or format-specific decision (brief record, full record)
label: (none)
definition: Library building/branch/larger location in which the shelving location is found
rationale: Inform user what library building or main section/area to go to in order to find the items covered by holdings statement
implementation details: Map to readable label for display

displayed: institution- and/or format-specific decision (brief record, full record)
label: (none)
definition: Shelving location code for items covered by the holdings statement
rationale: Inform user what section/area of stacks to go to in order to find the items covered by holdings statement
implementation details: Map to readable label for display

label: x
definition: Unique identifier for source data holdings record in host institution's ILS.
rationale: Of possible use for requesting or other features;;;UNC uses this to link to "Latest Received" display from our Sierra OPAC

displayed: institution- and/or format-specific decision (brief record, full record)
label: (none)
definition: Full call number from holdings record (classification number + shelving cutter + shelf marks + volume/copy designators)
rationale: Obtain resource

displayed: institution- and/or format-specific decision (brief record, full record)
label: (none)
definition: Public notes from the holdings record
rationale: Provide information on the run/span of items described that cannot be recorded elsewhere in holdings record.

definition: Broad category of resources that might be helpful for limiting searches.
rationale: The analogous Endeca property looks like it is only used by NCSU, but it could have broader use
notes: in Endeca, categories include "Gov Doc" and "Reference"
implementation details: Collaboratively maintain a vocabulary/set of types to use here, to avoid bizarre behavior after "expand to..."

label: x
definition: Higher-level (library, etc.) locations housing volumes/copies of the resource described in the bib record
rationale: Support for hierarchical location facet; polyhierarchy already existing in Endeca

definition: In cataloging terms, the "main entry" author---the primary author that is recorded in a 1xx field. By definition, this should be a creator of the work described
rationale: Was separate in Endeca, some UIs displayed this author field, when available, in the brief record display. Copied/re-used to create work_citation

definition: Director of film/video
rationale: Used in UNC FilmFinder. Important access point for discovering film/video.
notes: No separate director_relator field because "director" is the known relator here. "Directors and Performers" facet in UNC FilmFinder is the Author facet (dim=10), relabeled.

displayed: ? brief record and above-the-fold full record, if no creator_main value; details in full record if there is a creator_main value ?
definition: Editor of the described resource
rationale: Not supposed to be recorded as a main creator/author in a catalog record, however is used as filing/entry name in many citation styles. Recorded in a separate field, when possible, for use in improved citation builder features
notes: No separate editor_relator field because editor is the known relator here

definition: Creator and selected contributor names for narrowing down search results
The role of the creator_main name in relation to the work described
rationale: Should be displayed, but not included in facet value. How to handle in index needs discussion.

definition: Consistent/controlled version of the work title
rationale: Retrieve/collocate works where title has been recorded differently on separate versions (different language title, wording/spelling changed, etc.)
endeca equivalent: Main Uniform Title;;;Uniform Title;;;Journal Uniform Title
notes: This should definitely be a separate searchable string in the title index, but unsure whether it needs to be displayed on its own -- it will be part of the work_citation field which is probably more suitable for display
